p:
We used
λ = 3.0
,
κ = 0.6
, and
δ = 1.2
to minimize test error. Respectively, these terms represent the squared training error; an L1 regularization term on mutation effects, such that most values of
d m
= 0
; and L2 regularization terms on virus avidities and serum potencies, such that they are normally distributed. These parameter values are then used to predict the antigenic distance between all pairs of viruses,
i
and
j
. We assess performance by comparing predicted to known titer values in our test data set, and present test error (aggregated from 100-fold Monte Carlo cross-validation) throughout the manuscript.
